Factor.definition: one who acts or transacts business for another
Factor.origin: [Medieval Latin, doer, maker, agent, from Latin, maker, from facere to do, make]

1.definition: one who acts or transacts business for another

sub_terms.a: a commercial agent who buys or sells goods for others on commission
sub_terms.b: one that lends money to producers and dealers (as on the security of accounts receivable)

2.definition: a person or thing that actively contributes to the production of a result [a difference in salary based on a other than sex]
